Printing and Scanning

You can use the two print stations on ERBA island with the help of your student card. Simply submit the files you want to print to campusprint, the university's remote printing application. It is also available as a web application. Both of them can be utilized to scan documents, as well.

To connect to campusprint, you will need access to the university network, either by being physically present in the building or via a Virtual Private Network (VPN).

As opposed to scanning, printing obviously costs you a certain amount of credit from your student card, depending on the paper size, quality, and color configurations. Details can be found here. Although it is counter-intuitive, you should also have about 1,00 € of credit remaining in order to scan—which is free, nonetheless.

Students can only use two printers on ERBA island: the one in the library and the one on the fourth floor (WE5/04.006). All of the other printers can only be accessed by staff members. If you are closer to a different university building, have a look at the list of all printers.
